tit.cmt: タイトルのため、単語の頭文字を大文字に変更 *補足表記で"(Ashikagasho district)"とありますが、次の文にある「荘園」と一致しないため削除しました。

sen.j: 足利庄（あしかがのしょう）は、下野国足利郡（栃木県足利市）にあった荘園。
sen.e: Ashikaga no sho was shoen (manor) that was located in Ashikaga-gun, Shimotsuke Province (Ashikaga City, Tochigi Prefecture).
Ashikaga no sho was a shoen (manor) that was located in Ashikaga-gun, Shimotsuke Province (Ashikaga City, Tochigi Prefecture).
Ashikaga no sho was a shoen (manor) that was located in Ashikaga County, Shimotsuke Province (Ashikaga City, Tochigi Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 統一リストに基づき、Ashikaga-gun→Ashikaga Countyに修正

sen.j: 荘域は足利郡全域と安蘇郡の一部（赤見郷）。
sen.e: Its territory included the whole of Ashikaga-gun and a part of Aso-gun (Akami-go).
Its territory included the whole of Ashikaga-gun and a part of Aso-gun (Akami-go).
Its territory included the whole of Ashikaga County and a part of Aso County (Akami-go).

sen.j: 『延喜式』には下野国足利駅、『和名類聚抄』では足利郡駅家郷と記されている。
sen.e: It was described as Shimotsuke no kuni Ashikaga-eki in "Engishiki" (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers), and Ashikaga-gun Ekiya-go in "Wamyoruiju-sho" (Kango-Japanese dictionary).

It was described as Shimotsuke no kuni Ashikaga-eki in "Engishiki" (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers), and Ashikaga-gun Ekiya-go in "Wamyoruiju-sho" (Kango-Japanese dictionary).

It was described as Shimotsuke no kuni Ashikaga-eki in "Engishiki" (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers), and Ashikaga-gun Ekiya-go in "Wamyo Ruijusho" (A dictionary of Japanese names).
Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 藤原秀郷流の足利氏 (藤原氏)が領し、平安時代の仁安 (日本)年間には平氏が領する。
sen.e: It was originally owned by the Ashikaga clan of FUJIWARA no Hidesto line and in the Ninan (Japan) era of Heian period, it was owned by the Taira clan.
It was originally owned by the Ashikaga clan of the FUJIWARA no Hidesto line and in the Ninan (Japan) era of the Heian period, it was owned by the Taira clan.
It was originally owned by the Ashikaga clan of the FUJIWARA no Hidesato line and in the Ninan era (1166-1169) of the Heian period, it was owned by the Taira clan.
sen.cmt: FUJIWARA no Hidesto→FUJIWARA no Hidesatoに修正、Ninan era→Ninan era (1166-1169)とし、(Japan)削除 (参考: http://kotobank.jp/word/%E4%BB%81%E5%AE%89)

sen.j: 源氏の源頼朝により藤姓足利俊綱が滅ぼされると、源姓足利氏が領して地頭職を歴任する。
sen.e: After Toshitsuna ASHIKAGA of Fujiwara family was ruined by MINAMOTO no Yoritomo of Minamoto clan, the Ashikaga clan of Minamoto family owned it and successively inherited the position of jitoshiki (manager and lord of manor).

After Toshitsuna ASHIKAGA of the Fujiwara family was ruined by MINAMOTO no Yoritomo of the Minamoto clan, the Ashikaga clan of Minamoto family owned it and successively inherited the position of jitoshiki (manager and lord of manor).

After Toshitsuna ASHIKAGA of the Fujiwara family was ruined by MINAMOTO no Yoritomo of the Minamoto clan, the Ashikaga clan of Minamoto family owned it and successively inherited the position of jitoshiki (manager and lord of manor).

sen.j: 室町幕府が成立すると要地となり鎌倉府に管理される。が、
sen.e: After the establishment of Muromachi bakufu, it was managed by Kamakurafu (local government office Muromachi bakufu in Kamakura) as an important place.
After the establishment of the Muromachi bakufu, it was managed by the Kamakurafu (local government office Muromachi bakufu in Kamakura) as an important place.

After the establishment of the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), it was managed by the Kamakurafu (local government office Muromachi bakufu in Kamakura) as an important place.
sen.cmt: 初出のため、bakufuの補足追加

sen.j: 応永16年（1409年）の足利満兼の死後には幕府直轄地となり、幕府管領の被官が代官として派遣された。
sen.e: After Mitsukane ASHIKAGA died in 1409, it was placed under the direct control of bakufu and a vassal of bakufu kanrei (shogunal deputy) was dispatched as daikan (local governor).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After Mitsukane ASHIKAGA died in 1409, it was placed under direct control of the bakufu and a vassal of the bakufu kanrei (shogunal deputy) was dispatched as a daikan (local governor).
After Mitsukane ASHIKAGA died in 1409, it was placed under direct control of the bakufu and a vassal of the bakufu kanrei (shogunal deputy) was dispatched as a daikan (local governor).

sen.j: 将軍義教と鎌倉公方持氏の対立おいては、持氏が横領する事件も起こる（永享3年に和睦）。
sen.e: When shogun Yoshinori and Kamakura kubo (governor-general of Kanto region) Mochiuji were in conflict, Mochiuji once unlawfully seized it (settled in 1411).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When shogun Yoshinori and Kamakura kubo (governor-general of Kanto region) Mochiuji were in conflict, Mochiuji once unlawfully seized it (settled in 1411).
When shogun Yoshinori and Kamakura kubo (governor-general of Kanto region) Mochiuji were in conflict, Mochiuji once unlawfully seized it (settled in 1411).

sen.j: 源義国が源義家から伝えられた開発地を、安楽寿院(鳥羽上皇が建てた寺)に寄進（八条院領）。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yoshikuni donated the developed land which he inherited from MINAMOTO no YOSHIIE to Anrakujuin Temple (a temple constructed by the retired Emperor Toba) (Hachijoin territory).
MINAMOTO no Yoshikuni donated the developed land which he inherited from MINAMOTO no YOSHIIE to Anrakujuin Temple (a temple constructed by the retired Emperor Toba) (Hachijoin territory).
MINAMOTO no Yoshikuni donated the developed land which he inherited from MINAMOTO no Yoshiie to Anrakujuin Temple (a temple constructed by the Retired Emperor Toba) (Hachijoin territory).
sen.cmt: MINAMOTO no YOSHIIE→MINAMOTO no Yoshiie、the retired Emperor Toba→the Retired Emperor Tobaに修正

sen.e: Ashikaga no sho was established.
Ashikaga no sho was established.
Ashikaga no sho was established.

sen.j: - 源義国、足利荘に下向(源姓足利氏のはじまり)
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yoshikuni moved to Ashikaga no sho (the origin of the Ashikaga clan of Minamoto family).
MINAMOTO no Yoshikuni moved to Ashikaga no sho (the origin of the Ashikaga clan of the Minamoto family).
MINAMOTO no Yoshikuni moved to Ashikaga no sho (the origin of the Ashikaga clan of the Minamoto family).
Kamakura bakufu fell.
The Kamakura bakufu fell.
The Kamakura bakufu fell.

sen.j: - 足利尊氏が京都(室町)に幕府を開く
sen.e: Takauji ASHIKAGA established bakufu in Kyoto (Muromachi).
Takauji ASHIKAGA established a bakufu in Kyoto (Muromachi).
Takauji ASHIKAGA established a bakufu in Kyoto (Muromachi).

sen.j: 上杉憲実が足利学校を再興、書物を寄進
sen.e: Norizane UESUGI restored Ashikaga School and donated books.
Norizane UESUGI restored the Ashikaga School and donated books.
Norizane UESUGI restored the Ashikaga School and donated books.

sen.j: 足利藩主戸田忠行版籍を奉還、藩知事となる
sen.e: The lord of Ashikaga domain Tadayuki TODA returned lands and people to the Emperor and became the governor of domain.
The lord of Ashikaga domain Tadayuki TODA returned lands and people to the Emperor and became governor of the domain.
The lord of Ashikaga Domain Tadayuki TODA returned lands and people to the Emperor and became governor of the Domain.
sen.cmt: domainの頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: 廃藩置県で、足利県となる。
sen.e: It became Ashikaga Prefecture according to the policy of haihan-chiken (abolition of domains and establishment of prefectures).
It became Ashikaga Prefecture according to the policy of haihan-chiken (abolition of domains and establishment of prefectures).
It became Ashikaga Prefecture according to the policy of haihan-chiken (abolition of domains and establishment of prefectures).
It became Tochigi Prefecture in November.
It became Tochigi Prefecture in November.
It became Tochigi Prefecture in November.
